meanings.definition: The study of the characteristics, origin, and development of landforms.
meanings.sent1: In geomorphologies, scientists explore how mountains and valleys are formed.
meanings.sent2: The textbook on geomorphologies explains the different types of landforms.
meanings.sent3: The students found geomorphologies fascinating as they learned about the creation of canyons.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a map of geomorphologies, each memory a unique landform.
meanings.sent5: Through studying geomorphologies, one can understand the shaping of our planet's surface.

meanings.definition: The physical features of a region or area, especially the surface features of the earth.
meanings.sent1: The geomorphologies of the desert include sand dunes and rocky outcrops.
meanings.sent2: Geologists use geomorphologies to analyze the landscape and its changes over time.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted a beautiful landscape, capturing the geomorphologies of the hills.
meanings.sent4: Her face held the geomorphologies of time, each wrinkle a story etched in her skin.
meanings.sent5: The satellite images revealed the intricate geomorphologies of the coastline.
